lead_paragraph: Two books, published to coincide with the centennial of Nathan’s Famous by members of his family’s third generation, largely debunk a stubborn if serviceable legend.

headline.print_headline: What It Took to Make Nathan’s Famous
headline.main: Nathan’s Famous, a Hot Dog Empire Built on Hard Work and Hype

snippet: Two books, published to coincide with the centennial of Nathan’s Famous by members of his family’s third generation, largely debunk a stubborn if serviceable legend....
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Famous Nathan: A Family Saga of Coney Island, the American Dream and the Search for the Perfect Hot Dog by Lloyd Handwerker and Gil Reavill and Nathan’s Famous: The First 100 years, an Unauthorized View of America’s Favorite Frankfurter Company by William Handwerker and Jayne A Pearl.

keywords.value: Nathan's Famous: The First 100 years, an Unauthorized View of America's Favorite Frankfurter Company (Book)

keywords.value: Famous Nathan: A Family Saga of Coney Island, the American Dream and the Search for the Perfect Hot Dog (Book)
